text: Waverly is a city in the U.S. state of Kentucky. At the 2020 census, 311 people lived there. It was founded in 1870 and the city was named for founder Hugh McElroy's nephew. ==Geography== Waverly is at (37.709738, -87.815278). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has an area of 0.3 square miles (0.7 km2), and that all of it is land. == References == Category:Cities in Kentucky
title: Waverly, Kentucky
